sections.text: Praying at night, especially after one has slept for a while, is strongly encouraged in the Qur’an for the believers, and it was ordered for the Prophet (ﷺ).
﴿وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَتَهَجَّدْ بِهِ نَافِلَةً لَّكَ عَسَىٰ أَن يَبْعَثَكَ رَبُّكَ مَقَامًا مَّحْمُودًا﴾ Surah 17:79
Allah (subḥānahu wa-ta‘ālā) is especially close to His servants during the last part of the night, and du‘ā’ is even more likely to be answered at that time.
No specific number of rak‘ahs is prescribed, but the Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray eleven or thirteen lengthy rak‘ahs. Witr is included as part of the tahajjud prayer.
Tarāwīḥ prayers are those prayed at night in congregation or individually during the month of Ramaḍān.
